feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Thunderstorms Tonight... Strong thunderstorms are occuring and will continue into early Sunday morning. Frequent lightning, brief heavy rain, winds gusting to 30 mph and hail will occur. Some of the hail could be over 1 inch in diameter. People in higher terrain such as Eagle and Twelve Mile Summits, the Eastern Brooks Range and the Taylor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 7:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Along The Tanana River Into Next Week... High water continues along glacially fed rivers draining the Alaska Range, including the Delta, Nenana and Tanana Rivers. Warm temperatures continue to cause enhanced glacial and high elevation snowmelt runoff. Low lying areas along these rivers may fill with water. Increased river bank erosion will occur.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 28 at 9:26AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PM-10 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY SUNDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued a PM-10 High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence on Sunday. An episode of strong and gusty winds is forecast to generate widespread blowing dust that may result in local PM-10 concentrations
entry.cap:areaDesc: Pinal

entry.cap:areaDesc: Bastrop; Burnet; Lee; Llano; Travis; Williamson

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued July 29 at 1:42PM MDT until July 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...High temperatures up to 104. Low temperatures in the mid to upper 70s. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front and Salt Lake Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 29 at 4:16PM PDT until July 30 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... .Westerly winds have increased over portions of south central Washington and eastern Oregon this afternoon. Although winds will decrease tonight, the gusty winds will return on Sunday. The afternoon relative humidity will be in the teens...locally single
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Columbia Basin
